bwwExcerpt: Memory floats on a giant plane of regret in American Repertory Theater's epic and intimate production of "The Glass Menagerie," trapped forever between a shimmering black sea and an endless void that even an infinite fire escape can't reach. Tennessee Williams' world of poetry and prose is presented gracefully, even wondrously, in this distinctive production - helmed by John Tiffany ("Once") and starring Cherry Jones and Zachary Quinto - that no doubt will have Gotham's gentlemen and women comin
